title: 114_s2131
content: Sec. 560 prohibits the Department of Homeland Security from obligating funds for structural pay reform affecting more than 100 full-time equivalent employee positions or costing more than $5,000,000 in a single year without notifying Congress with specific details and justifications. Sec. 561 requires agencies receiving funds from this Act to post required reports on their public website, unless it compromises security or contains proprietary information. The head of the agency must make the report available to Congress for 45 days before posting. Sec. 562 rescinds $27,338,101 from the Disaster Assistance Direct Loan Program. Sec. 563 transfers $56,872,752 in unobligated balances to the Disaster Relief Fund for authorized purposes. Sec. 564 prohibits the use of funds from this Act for domestic prosecutions related to the Arms Trade Treaty until the Treaty is ratified by the Senate and implementing legislation is adopted by both the Senate and the House of Representatives. Sec. 565 rescinds funds from various Department of Homeland Security accounts and programs, totaling $36,180,000 from unobligated prior year balances. No amounts can be rescinded from emergency-designated funds. The text chunk summarizes the rescinding of funds totaling $36,180,000 from various Department of Homeland Security accounts and programs, including funds from U.S. Customs and Border Protection, Border Security, Fencing, Infrastructure, and Technology, Air and Marine Operations, Construction and Facilities Management, Federal Emergency Management Agency, Coast Guard, and National Predisaster Mitigation Fund. Sec. 566 rescinds funds totaling $36,180,000 from various Department of Homeland Security accounts and programs, including the Coast Guard, Transportation Security Administration, and Science and Technology research and development. $175,000,000 shall be rescinded from the unobligated balances in the Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund. The Secretary of Homeland Security may designate Poland as a program country under the visa waiver program. This is part of the Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2016.
